title: Google removes AI overviews from some medical searches after false health information sparks backlash
snippet: Google has removed AI overviews for certain health queries after reports of misleading information that could harm users. However, taking small changes to these search queries is still leading to AI Overviews coming up.

title: OnePlus Nord 6 spotted on certifications, global launch may be imminent: Report
snippet: OnePlus may bring its Turbo 6 series to global markets under the Nord branding. A GSMArena report suggests the OnePlus Nord 6 has cleared key certifications, hinting at an India launch in early 2026, with flagship-grade performance and a massive 9,000mAh battery.

title: After months of setbacks, Apple’s AI Siri may launch soon: Report
snippet: Apple’s long-delayed AI-powered Siri could finally near the launch. Featuring personal context, on-screen awareness and app actions, the revamped assistant could debut with iOS 26.4 as early as March or April, according to recent reports.

title: Did you receive a mail to reset Instagram password? Is it a data breach? Is it a 2022 claim going viral? Meta responds
snippet: As Malwarebytes reported the breach, many users confirmed that they had indeed received password reset emails. Cybersecurity researchers, however, pointed out that Instagram had not been hacked recently and the data that is supposedly available on the dark web is from 2022.

title: Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth to hold high-stakes meeting, urging employees to attend: Report
snippet: Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth is reportedly set to hold what he calls the most important meeting of the year, urging Reality Labs employees to attend in person amid mounting losses, recent layoffs and growing scrutiny of Meta’s metaverse and hardware strategy.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 series tipped for February 25 global launch: What to expect
snippet: Samsung’s Galaxy S26 series, expected to include the S26, S26+ and S26 Ultra, is tipped to launch on February 25. Leaks suggest delayed sales, possible price hikes and region-specific Exynos 2600 or Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chips.

title: I wanted to buy a Full HD LED monitor, and these are my top choices in a budget
snippet: On a budget hunt for a Full HD LED monitor that does not disappoint? These picks cut through the clutter with clear visuals, honest performance and pricing that keeps your wallet calm.

title: Minecraft Bedrock Realms users report widespread loading and connection issues: What we know so far
snippet: Minecraft Bedrock Realms reportedly experienced a widespread outage on Saturday, with thousands of players reporting loading failures and server connection issues. DownDetector data showed a sharp spike in complaints across multiple US cities, disrupting multiplayer gameplay.

title: Meta urges Australia to change teen social media ban
snippet: Tech giant Meta urged Australia on Monday to rethink its world-first social media ban for under-16s, while reporting that it has blocked more than 544,000 accounts under the new law. title: Google teams up with Walmart and other retailers to enable shopping within Gemini AI chatbot
snippet: An instant checkout function will allow customers to make purchases from some businesses and through a range of payment providers without leaving the Gemini chat they used to find products, according to Walmart and Google.

title: BrowserStack's $125 million buyback; crypto rules tighten
snippet: Happy Monday! Kicking off the new year on a high, BrowserStack is facilitating a big share buyback for employees and early investors. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: IT hardware distributor Mitsumi Distribution eyes Rs 1,000 crore India play
snippet: Mitsumi Distribution is entering India with a Rs 700–1,000 crore investment over three years to build infrastructure, inventory and logistics. title: Mixed Q3 awaits Indian ER&D companies navigating auto sector headwinds
snippet: Indian engineering service firms like Tata Elxsi, KPIT and LTTS are set for a mixed Q3 due to weak auto demand, though rising R&D in EVs and hybrids offers support. Analysts expect modest 1–2.8% revenue growth, with EU-focused companies benefiting more than US-exposed peers. These firms' FY26 gr

title: BrowserStack’s $125 million share buyback to create cash liquidity for 500 employees, early investors
snippet: BrowserStack will buy back $125 million worth of shares, offering liquidity to employees and early investors using its own profits. Nearly 500 staff will benefit as part of the programme. With this deal, BrowserStack’s total share buybacks across three programmes will be worth around $275 million.
